threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered trojan. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

attributes.magic: ELF 64-bit LSB executable, x86-64, version 1 (SYSV), statically linked, missing section headers at jd

crowdsourced_ai_results.analysis: This sample is a highly sophisticated Linux backdoor and rootkit, referred to in its own strings as a 'Full Stealth Module.' It features advanced persistence mechanisms (cron, systemd, LD_PRELOAD), container escape modules for Docker and Kubernetes (k8s_privesc_v3), and eBPF-based stealth capabilities. The implant performs extensive credential harvesting, targeting SSH keys, AWS/Kubernetes configurations, and command histories across various shells and databases. It maintains C2 communication via encrypted beacons to endpoints like '/api/v2/sync' and employs significant anti-forensic measures, including the clearing of system logs (wtmp, lastlog) and disabling bash history. Relevant IOCs include the use of '/tmp/.vl_*' and '/var/tmp/.vl_*' file paths, and eBPF loader scripts.
